intro: Marinellia arvensis, commonly known as the field milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in temperate climates. The plant features slender stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and range in color from white to pale pink. Marinellia arvensis is known for its ability to attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
